definition: to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Hope that the United States will abandon the Cold War mentality, not in Hongkong to engage in political gamesmanship.
sentences.chinese: 希望美方摒弃冷战思维，不在香港搞政治上的小动作。

sentences.english: We should get rid of the bad style and keep the good.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该摒弃不良作风，保持优良作风。

sentences.english: You can’t have good ideas unless you’re willing to generate a lot of bad ones.
sentences.chinese: 除非摒弃诸多不良想法才会有好点子。

sentences.english: As to prophecies, intelligent writers gave them up long ago.
sentences.chinese: 至于预言书，明智的作家们早就将它们摒弃了。

sentences.english: Last night was a night for banishing regrets.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚是一个摒弃悔恨的晚上。

sentences.english: Abandoning or spoiling the justice will make the law become evil law or bad law.
sentences.chinese: 在法中摒弃或作贱正义，便会使法沦为恶法或劣法。

sentences.english: People would be wise to abandon rash inclinations and instead try in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 人们摒弃急燥冒进并代之以严肃认识是明智之举。

sentences.english: Now, eliminate time. You follow what we are doing?
sentences.chinese: 现在，摒弃时间。你明白我们正在做什么吗？

sentences.english: We must blot out the personal enmities at this time.
sentences.chinese: 此时我们必须摒弃个人之间的恩怨。

sentences.english: Well,maybe that metahphysical claim I just made should be abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 也许我刚才提出的形而上学表述应该被摒弃。

sentences.english: When a society abandons economic growth, is there any reason for favouring profit?
sentences.chinese: 当一个社会摒弃经济增长时，还会有获利的希望么？

sentences.english: This site has been wholly abandoned with the Deep Pool fenced against people over the past twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 本网站已完全摒弃对人的深池围栏，在过去的二十年。

sentences.english: Scott Gill trusted himself, let go of the outcome and lived.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特吉尔相信自己的判断，摒弃杂念快乐生活。

sentences.english: Life is the abnegation of self to gain the bliss of Nirvana.
sentences.chinese: 生命是为了达到极乐的涅磐而摒弃自身。

definition: to discard/to get rid of/to dispense with
to throw out/to get rid of
to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
to follow/to abide by/to comply with/compliance
